intro: Adesmia axillaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf burr mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Adesmia axillaris is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
